kenyan.text: It is the grass that suffers when elephants fight.
Blind belief is dangerous.
He who refuses to obey cannot command.
Peace is costly, but it is worth the expense.
Peace is costly but it is worth the expense.
A man who uses force is afraid of reasoning.
The jaws have nothing to chew if the feet do not walk.
The mouth does not eat if the feet do not walk and the hands work.
All cassavas have the same skin but not all taste the same.
At the harvest, you know how good the millet is.
Because a man has injured your goat, do not go out and kill his bull.
Do not slaughter a calf before its mother’s eyes.
Don’t count what they get — they count what they don’t get.
A hyena cannot smell its own stench.
A lone runner says he has legs (runs fast).
A messenger cannot be beaten.
A person changing his clothing always hides while changing.
Crawling on hands and knees has never prevented anyone from walking upright.
Do not say the first thing that comes to your mind.
A rat-trap catches both the guilty and the innocent.
A rope parts where it is thinnest.
A sinking ship doesn’t need a captain.
A slave has no choice.
A true person is the one who gives birth to a foolish child.
A woman’s stomach does not grow if she is not pregnant.
A word in the heart does not win.
All monkeys cannot hang on the same branch.
An empty pot makes the loudest noise
An old pot never lacks food remnants.
An orphaned calf licks its own back.
Having a good discussion is like having riches.
He who does not know one thing knows another.
He who is unable to dance blames it on the stony yard.
How easy it is to defeat people who do not kindle fire for themselves.
Traveling is learning.
A man’s actions are more important than his ancestry.
A slippery person is not a king.
An empty pot makes the loudest noise.
Do not follow a person who is running away.
Even if you bewitch in the night, you will be known.
Every door has its own key.
Glory does not come by calling.
He who is unable to dance says the yard is stony.
However much it rains on you, no wild banana tree will grow on your head.
If you do not know death, look at the grave.
No masika (rain season) without mosquitoes.
No water without waves.
One arrow can knock down an elephant.
One who relates with a corrupt person likewise gets corrupted.
One whose seeds have not sprouted does not give up planting.
Only a medicine man gets rich by sleeping.
Only someone else can scratch your back.
Suppression of hunger leads to death.
The blame of the antelope is on the hunter.
The cow that bellows does so for all cows.
The day before yesterday and yesterday are not the same as today.
The enemy you know is better than the one you do not know.
The hen pecks and wipes its beak.
The man may be the head of the home, but the wife is the heart.
The stick in the hand kills the snake.
To lead is not to run roughshod over people
We should put out fire while it is still small.
We should talk while we are still alive.
When the lion cannot find meat, it eats grass.
When you mention the person with one eye, the one with the eye problem reacts.
Leadership comes from God.
A leader who does not take advice is not a leader.
Unity is the real thing.
A flea can trouble a lion more than a lion can trouble a flea.
If you are bitten by a snake you fear seeing a rope at night.
Having a good discussion is like having riches
A letter from the heart can be read on the face.
If anyone makes you laugh, it is not always because they love you.
The day the monkey is destined to die all the trees get slippery.
A fully grown up tree cannot be bent into a walking stick.
Work done in the right way rewards both the employer and the employee.
The enemy you know is better than the one you don’t know.
What’s too hard for a man must be worth looking into.
A flea can trouble a lion more than the lion can harm a flea.
One finger alone cannot even kill a louse.
You may laugh at a friend’s roof; don’t laugh at his sleeping accommodation.
He, who does not know one thing knows another.
kenyan.description: No one knows everything, but everyone knows something.

kenyan.text: Who does not know one thing knows another.
kenyan.description: No one knows everything, but everyone knows something.

kenyan.text: If a dead tree falls, it carries with it a live one.
Thunder is not yet rain.
At the harvest you know how good the millet is.
The water of the river flows on without waiting for the thirsty man.
A donkey always says thank you with a kick.
Virtue is better than wealth.
Old age devours your youth.
Talking to one another is loving one another.
Only believe a woman one day later.
A white dog does not bite another white dog.
Soon found, soon lost.
No attention is paid to him who is always complaining.
If you receive a gift don’t measure it.
We have not inherited this land from our ancestors; rather we have borrowed it from our children.
Man counts what he has refused, not what he has given.
It is the duty of children to wait on elders, and not the elders on children.
Nobody walks with another man’s gait.
When you take a knife away from a child, give him a piece of wood instead.
You may laugh at a friend's roof; don't laugh at his sleeping accommodation.
If you receive a gift don't measure it.
Just because he harmed your goat, do not go out and kill his bull.
Never let a hyena know how well you can bite.
Nobody gathers firewood to roast a thin goat.
Nobody walks with another man's gait.
Once you have been tossed by a buffalo, a black ox looks like a buffalo.
After a foolish deed comes remorse.
All cassavahs have the same skins but not all taste the same.
Do not slaughter a calf before its mother's eyes.
Don't count what they get -- they count what they don't get.
Each has his own way of moving.
Only scratch where you can reach.
Seeing is different from being told.
Sticks in a bundle are unbreakable.
Talking with one another is loving one another.
A heavy burden does not kill on the day it is carried.
A loved one has no pimples.
A man's actions are more important than his ancestry.
Absence makes the heart forget.
Affairs of the home should not be discussed in the public square.
There is no cure that does not have its price.
There is no phrase that doesn't have a double meaning.
Treat the earth well. It was not given to you by your parents. It is loaned to you by your children.
Treat the world well. It was not given to you by your parents. It was willed to you by your children.
Try this bracelet: if it fits you wear it; but if it hurts you, throw it away no matter how much it sparkles.
What's too hard for a man must be worth looking into.
When the figs are ripe all the birds want to eat.
He who is unable to dance blames it in the stony yard.
Hearts do not meet one another like roads.
How gently glides the married life away, When she who rules still seems but to obey.
A boy isn't sent to collect the honey.
A man who continually laments is not heeded.
Do not say the first thing that comes to your mind
Good millet is known at the harvest.
Try this bracelet: if it fits you wear it; but if it hurts you, throw it away no matter how shiny.
One does not slaughter a calf before its mother's eyes.
One finger alone cannot kill even a louse.
Soon found soon lost.
The important things are left in the locker.
There is no cure that does not cost.
There is no phrase without a double meaning.
Those who get to the river early drink the cleanest water.
He who is unable to dance says that the yard is stony.
He who receives a gift does not measure.
Home affairs are not talked about on the public square.
Hurry hurry has no blessings.
'Kanywanjui' scratches its thigh.
A branch of 'mutundu' does not hinder the division of a field.
A cunning man likes the company of a fool.
A danger escaped is no guarantee for the future.
A fair daughter's father has no ears.
A good action reaps another.
A good friend is a treasure.
A good millstone does not meet a good miller.
A joke can break the earring.
A joke must not hit the belly.
Kamau who is white becomes black.
Live men do not lack work.
Lying is the thief's stronghold.
Many people together lift up the 'ndiri'.
Me do not know hard firewood, but only lops people put aside hard tasks and devote themselves only to easy ones.
Meat has no choice morsel.
Men are equal whe they are going and walking.
Men do not know liberality.
Men have got quills.
Necessities never end.
Young suga-cane gives no beer.
Not to talk is to hate.
Old people's walking teaches young ones to walk.
One ages every night one lives.
One appointment is eatedn by another.
One can lose four and eight.
One favours him from whom one has in the past received a gift.
One finger does not kill a louse.
Other's ornaments tire one's neck.
People are consumed by evil because of keeping close to it, but not because of keeping away from it.
People count the refusals, do not count the gifts.
The animal caught in the trap does not refuse to set itself free.
The animal rambling in the stable makes the sleeping ones rise too.
The antelope detests the one who announces its whereabouts more than the one who sees it.
The baby nursed by its grandmother can never be corrected.
The baby that refuses its mother's breast, will never be full.
The bird who has always possessed a beak, does not pick up for another.
The blessed knife eats of the meat of the 'kinandu'.
The breaking of a betrothal is no small matter.
The buying of a wife begins from a little thing.
The chest contains a beehive full of pride.
A piece of land is not a little thing.
A plant loses its blossom as soon as it bears fruit.
A really good thing is ever good.
A river drowns the one who can swim.
A secret agreement enabled people to kill Watatua.
A slaughterhouse is not without a little blood.
A small red snuff-box is a welcome.
A son as cunning as his father knows the arrows like father.
A stupid turtle-dove is sometimes surprised by night for wanting one more grain of castor-oil plant.
A trick is not an arrow.
To keep one's tongue is worthy of praise.
To pound water with a mortar is futile.
To seek a woman to the belly.
To stay together is to know each other.
To wait is not to tremble.
Travelling is learning.
Travelling is seeing.
Travelling teaches men their way.
Two guests have no welcome.
Two guests love a different song.
Cooked food is not sold for goats.
Cutting by the tongue is different from cutting by the knife.
Darkness caused to dance even him who cannot.
Darkness shows no wrong path to she who gets what she wants before dark.
Every case begins from the stomach.
Every feast has ists guest of honour.
Everybody regrets not what he leaves but what he does not find.
Fools rejoice for a bad thing.
For a jest one should not take the arrow out of the quiver.
From a jest comes a strife.
Goats fall that take hold of lichens.
Great haste breaks the yam tuber.
Having rain clouds is not the same as having rain..
He is a man that looks after maney as 'njuu' looks after locusts.
He who adorns himself knows to what sort of dance he is going.
He who does not know the road delays also one that knows it.
He who does not know, knows after being told.
He who goes around with his body upright, later on will go crawling.
He who is full does not understand what is told.
He who is stricken knows how to defend himself.
Two rich persons do not wish each other a bird of ill omen.
Two smells of cooking meat break the hyena's legs.
Two waterfalls do not hear each other.
Two wives are two pots full of poison.
Virtue is better than riches.
Virtue is power.
Vultures arrive at the place where the goat is slaughtered.
We speak byh proverb: he who is intelligent will understand.
What is in Masai is not in Kikuyu.
When 'ithare' is uprooted 'mugumo' grows in its place.
To be praised is to be ruined.
To be slim does not mean having been pared.
To blame the wind for the rain that does not fall.
To come out of one's house means learning.
To despise the ox means to despise also a strip of hide from it.
To eat much leaves you with a swollen belly.
To forget a strong man who could help you is the same as to scorn him.
To forget is the same as to throw away.
To get the warmth of fire one must stir the embers.
To go does not prevent a man from returning.
He who seeks his goat with the man who ate it, is certain not to find it.
He who spends his time adorning himself knows he is going to a dance.
Home affairs are not to be carried on in the public squuare.
Home affairs cannot be told to the public.
Home affairs have their staff, which cannot be brandished by anyone but the head of the house.
Home affairs must not go into the open.
Hyena says that men are wise because they know how to hold a firebrand.
If anybody makes you laugh, it is not always because he loves you.
If the cap fits wear it.
If the first goat goes lame, those that follow will not reach the pasture.
The lawsuit of a fool keeps the court all day.
The little bird that flaps its wings too much will spoil them.
The man that serves is not prevented from being served in turn.
The man who has no impurity will be helped even by peels he sees on the road.
The mouth is a chink.
The mouth sells the head.
The mouth that has saliva does not lack words.
The mouth who ate the seeds asks, 'Now what shall I plant?'.
The one who used to jump across the stream may find herself wading through..
The only friendly cow is the one which gives milk.
The stream does not pass over an old stone.
The timid ox drinks muddy watr.
The tooth laughs with the lance.
The village, which has got a whetstone, does not blunt the knife.
The vulture perches on the trees because it does not feel sure on the groung.
The war of the eyes never comes to an end.
The war that has no unity will make no prey,.
The whetstone in a village does no blunt the knife.
The widow's sons have not tears.
The woman who gives birth to a child is like the banana tree that breaks under the weight of its fruit.
The fact that you have gone near the battle-field does not mean that you fought.
The fear keeps your house poor.
The fed baby plays on its mother's bed.
The flea troubles him who has got it in his ear.
The food eaten first lasts longest in the stomach.
The food found Wacu in the field.
The food that is in the mouth is not yet in the belly.
The fool takes many people with him.
The foot and the earth cannot help meeting.
The forest of an unpleasant person is the one that has trees.
People slander somebody even if they do not despise him.
People who have not secret agreement are beaten by a single club.
Prophet copies a prophet.
Quarrelling is peculiar to the woman who has got male children.
Resist the beginnings.
Rich people cook their food in a potsherd.
Rich people sometimes eat badfood.
Riches and poverty do not leave each other.
Riches are found in cultivating together.
She who ignores advice does not resist when being prepared for burial.
A knife and a shaving-knife are alike.
A lame of heart is not a lame of leg; he cannot be recognized.
A little idleness causes the ruin of the beehive.
A little idleness lost a tilled field.
A little, contemptible path is sometimes the one that leads you to the highway.
A long lawsuit breeds poverty.
A man changing his abode is like a woman marrying.
A man is poor not because he scorns possessions, but because he possesses nothing.
A market can be spoilt by one woman.
A person will change his mind on something if left to sleep over it.
Some hope for rain even though they have not prepared their fields.
Stolen things bring in misfortune.
Strength does not correspond with courage.
Strength has nothing.
Take an oath only for the hand youslept on.
Talking something over is better than leaving it pending.
Ten helpless people were surpassed by a single strong person.
That of circumcision is a hard appointment.
The 'gicegu' of many men is not good.
The abyss laughs at the plain.
The ram that is shown around is not fat.
The rambling pole-cat leaves its house when there is banquet.
The rich man cannot be prevented from cyltivating the 'iganjo' he wants.
The river is crossed where it is shallow.
The sky is heavy with rain, but does not come.
The sleeping dog is turned by a stick.
The son does not cut his finger in cutting meat for his father.
The son of the leopard scratches like its mother.
The song of a stranger-woman is answered after she has gone.
The song that has no leader, goes wrong.
If you help yourself you will be helped.
In every family where there is a son, the head of an ox, goat or ram is cooked to be eaten by him with his friends.
In the presence of elderly people one must not pour water.
Indulgence breeds regret.
It is always the potato of another family's boy that extinguishes the fire.
It is bad to get old, for one goes to bed grumbling.
It is bad to stay at home.
It is he who got milk that is merciful.
It is not the mother's will to have a bad offspring.
It is not the owner, trampling his own field, that spoils it.
There is no partridge which does not know its own way of scratching.
There is no pleasure that does not cause one's cheeks to tremble.
There is no rain which does not enrich someone.
There is no thing which does not cause another to exist.
There is no tree which a panting animal would not cling to.
There is not the son of the front and the son of the back.
There is nothing without a cause.
Thieves conceal themselves in the night not in the day.
To be laughed at by men is not to be wept by hyenas.
To be laughed at is not to be pitied.
When an elephant combats, it is the grass that suffers.
When elephants fight, it is the grass that suffers.
When hyenas go away jackals rejoice.
When the food is cooked there is no need to wait before eating it.
When there is shortage of figs, birds eat the fruits of the 'mugumo'.
Wind makes more noise among the trees.
Wives and oxen have no friends.
Women have no upright words, but only crooked ones.
You cannot make an appointment with death.
You spoke with your own mouth.
No day dawns like another.
No evil, but only the good will last.
No married woman will have her white hair shaved at her mother's.
No partridge is small when it claws the soil.
No prepotent man will insult other people for two consecutive seasons.
No war has been fought by men carrying a calabash of 'njohi' but of 'ucuru'.
Nobody calls another's father 'dad'.
Nobody can see his own goodness: it can be seen only by others.
Nobody cares about other people's poverty.
Nobody cries that has not been pinched.
Nobody entering a hut pays for the heart he will enjoy in it.
Nobody grumbles at being rich, all at being poor.
Nobody grumbles while carrying a load, but when he has laid it down.
Nobody is born wise.
Nobody knows where he goes, but only whence he comes.
Nobody returns where he got his finger bitten,.
Nobody throws a lance if he has no target.
Nobody wants to meet an ill-omened bird.
The cimex lives in the firewood and still it reaches its full growth.
The cooking pot on the fire leaks, when pouring water it is broken.
The cow has a bad delivery though her owner is present.
The cow is given a present when her calf is carried away.
The cow that drops her calf in the sun feeds it there too.
The day is for working, the night is for resting.
The dunghill grows by straws thrown upon it.
The elders drink afterwards.
The elders of the council do not jump over a brook.
The enemy i know is better than the one i do not know.
The goat slaughtered for a man who is sick now, finds another who ws sick long before.
The goats pasture with bells hanging from their necks in order not to stray.
The good milking cow is praised after her death.
The grove of the hear is not laid open.
The hump of the ox that has grown old must be eaten by women.
The hunter's son knows how to hunt.
The hyena calls another hyena worse than itself.
The hyena does not eat its baby, and you know how insatiable it is.
The Kikuyu know how to conceal their quiver, but do not know how to conceal their secrets.
The land enriches not people who clear it, but people who come.
The only thing good, though old, is the 'muratina'.
The ox that claws the 'kiara' will die.
The ox that feeds itself does not spoil its skin.
The ox that ran away cannot be caught.
The ox which has grown old has no admirer.
The ox which has no horns, relies for help on the one that has them.
The piece of cloth that is in another's bag does not patch your garmet.
The pit allows the grass to fall in.
The place to use the club and the above arrow are not the same.
The property of a helpless man must nit be divided before his death.
A wily person does not walk on dry leaves.
Another's mouth cannot take the oath for you.
Beggars have no worries.
Birds agree when flying down, but do not agree when flying up.
Bought things do not fill the granary.
Boys and sugar-cane grow up as enemies.
By staying always in the same place one gets lice.
Candidates for circumcision.
Change seeds taking them from different calabashes.
Clear out of the 'thakirio'.
The woman whose sons have died is richer than a barren woman.
The word that remains in the belly does not mean anything.
There is no bow without its meat.
There is no butcher that does not slaughter.
There is no difference between the thief and the looker-on.
There is no location which discusses its affairs in the same way as the other does.
There is no man that cannot become an orphan.
There is no mischance you are guaranteed against.
There is no name which cannot distinguish a child.
There is no nice bird in the millet.
Many births mean many burials.
Hurrying has no blessing.
A flea can trouble a lion more than the lion can harm a flea.
A friend in power is a friend lost.
Seeing rain clouds in the sky is not the same as getting wet.
Never talk about a rope in the house of a man who has just been hanged.
Competition exhausted the lungs.
A woman who wants a child cannot sleep with her clothes on.
It is better for the eye to die than the heart.
A rope parts where is thinnest.
Rushing is not important, making sure is.
The early riser avoids the dew.
You shouldn’t hate someone unless you have slept in their house.
If you want to kill a monkey, avoid looking him in the eyes.
A debt between children born by the same mother is paid in a clever way.
You will notice no hills on the road to your loved one.
The cries of a goat do not prevent it from reaching the market.
The sun does not refuse to shine on a village just because it is small
It is better to be poor when one is young, rather than becoming poor at old age.
Water doesn’t stay in the sky forever.
No one can pass twice between the thighs of an elephant.
Anyone who urinates in a stream should be warned because any of his relatives may drink from the water.
Cut your nose to save your face.
Two fingers cannot enter the same nostril.
The chief’s dog is chief of the dogs.
It is only a fool that sweats in water.
No matter how much the world changes, cats will never lay eggs.
Good fortune doesn’t roar like a lion.
He who keeps the company of a bad person, themselves becomes bad.
Empty stomachs create friendships.
A black ant will not bite another.
Bad dancing does not break an engagement.
No one can use another person’s teeth to smile.
A bird does not change its feathers because the weather is bad.
The grave of the gravedigger is never deep.
A man’s teeth cannot grow taller than his penis.
The sweetness of sugar is not in its color
Greatness and beauty do not belong to the gods alone.
Even an expert swimmer drowns.
A child can play with its mother’s breasts in public, but it cannot dare play with its father’s testicles.
Don’t sweep another’s house whilst your own is dirty.
There is no phrase that doesn’t have a double meaning.
No matter how tall the neck is, the head will always be on top of it.
Burning charcoal is turned into ashes.
The horns of a cow cannot be hidden.
There is no difference between growing old and living your life.
No matter how tall your grandfather was, you have to do your own growing.
Follow bees and get honey.
The elephant and the tiger do not go hunting on the same pasture.
No one feels the pains that arise from unintended injury.
Even the small leopard is called leopard.
Help yourself and God will help you.
Two footsteps do not make a path.
A cat wearing gloves catches no mouse.
Before swallowing a mango seed, first calculate the diameter of your anus.
Even a friend cannot rescue one from old age.
Sleep and indolence are not cousins of a good harvest.
If it doesn’t resemble dad, it resembles mum.
He who wants to sleep in the middle must be first to arrive.
Intelligence is like hair, everyone has its own.
The only time you will see a quiet snake is when it has swallowed another snake.
The gods only hear one wish at a time, and nothing more.
Bartered grains do not fill up the granary.
You cannot shave a man in his absence.
Blessings are better than possessions.
Two watermelons cannot be held under one arm.
An old banana leaf was once young and green.
Do not follow a person who is running a way.
No matter how far a man urinates, the last drop will always fall between his knees.
A man who sleeps with your mother can slap you in her absence.
The owl is the wisest of all birds because the more it sees, the less it talks.
The deeds of a Man are greater than the details of his birth.
If gold rusts, what will iron do?
Before the gods destroy you, they first make you mad.
Two men quarrelling do not share the same seat on a canoe.
Every bird flies with its own wings.
The house of a madman is never burnt.
If a greedy eater is near a patient, such a patient can never survive.
When an elephant falls, meat is sure to be surplus for those who follow the hunter.
A fowl does not forget where it lays its eggs.
There is no elephant that complains about the weight of its trunk. No elephant is burdened by the weight of its tusks.
A dead rat feels no cold.
Do not accuse someone of witchcraft before they have cast a spell.
Good things sell, bad things advertise.
Dip after dip depletes a jar of honey.
If a soup is sweet, it is money that cooks it.
A child does not die because the mother’s breasts are dry.
When a ripe fruit sees an honest man, it drops.
He who does not look ahead always remains behind.
When the right hand washes the left hand and the left hand washes the right hand, both hands become clean.
Feet cannot stop one from going into danger.
He who wants what is under a bed must bend over to get it.
Beauty is not sold or eaten
A friend is someone who knows the song in your heart and can sing it back to you when you have forgotten the words.
